main event: Witnesses observed an unidentified object in the sky over Yellow Springs, Ohio on August 15, 1968, describing it as having a plate-like and then a spherical shape, with erratic movements, for about 50 minutes.
interesting points: Witness initially mistook the object for the moon but later believed it was not, due to its unusual motion. The sighting involved four witnesses, including an engineering student. There were inconsistencies in the reported time of the sighting among the witnesses. No physical evidence was found to support the sighting. The investigation concluded it was unidentified but was hopeful for more data later.
witness description: Witnesses included a married couple and their parents, with conflicting reports on the object's characteristics and movement.
